page.title: 13Entertainment
page.content: People who live in the country are usually some distance away from the nearest place of entertainment. They sometimes go by car to the nearest town to see a film or a show but more often they support the events which happen in their own or a neighbouring village hall. Different groups put on events like socials and discos. There is usually a branch of the Women's Institute in a village and also a club for old people. The village hall often has classes run by the County Council in the winter. The other main place for social evenings is the village inn. In the days when few people had cars everyone would go to their nearest public house, but nowadays you meet people from other places who have come out for an evening in the country.
